name: NPR
text:
RT @WorldCafe: The two country-leaning singer-songwriters on their time in Nashville, addressing the darkness of life while staying in the light and the difficulties of thinking forward in the South. @beccamancari
@SGGoodmanKY https://t.co/exp9y836AJ

name: NPR
text:
Dr. Deborah Birx says the CDC is working on a new way to track COVID-19 hospitalizations ‚Äî just a month after the Trump administration mandated that hospitals sidestep the CDC in collecting such data.
https://t.co/WTVjeaX8P8

name: NPR
text:
It's the final night of the #DemConvention. 

Joe Biden is set to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for president and will take center stage to lay out his vision for America.

Join us for live video and analysis.
https://t.co/yKej0YASKl

name: NPR
text:
Andrew Yang: ‚ÄúI have gotten to know both Joe and Kamala on the trail over the past year ... They understand the problems we face. They are parents and patriots who want the best for our country." #DemConvention
https://t.co/xRDbSf96ql

name: NPR
text:
Introducing a tribute to the late civil rights icon John Lewis, Atlanta Mayor Keisha Lance Bottoms says: ‚ÄúThe baton has now been passed to each of us.‚Äù 

‚ÄúWe must register, and we must vote.‚Äù #DemConvention https://t.co/oHT13Lr7mo

name: NPR
text:
Democrats once again honored Rep. John Lewis, the late civil rights icon, who died last month. ‚ÄúFrom day one, John Lewis was a role model in the Congress,‚Äù said House Speaker Nancy Pelosi in a tribute video. #DemConvention
https://t.co/0VbnxzI7Y4

name: NPR
text:
Julia Louis-Dreyfus quipped that she can‚Äôt wait to see the vice presidential debate featuring Kamala Harris and ‚ÄúMica Pints ‚Ä¶ or is it Paints?‚Äù she said at the DNC, taking aim at Republicans who can't seem to pronounce Kamala Harris' name correctly.
https://t.co/QZbac55Y2R

name: NPR
text:
Rep. Deb Haaland is a 35th generation New Mexican and one of the first Native Americans elected to Congress.

‚ÄúWhether we vote and how we vote will determine if our nation‚Äôs promise of social, racial and environmental justice will outlast us," she says.
https://t.co/h2sjMF9Dvh

name: NPR
text:
Sen. Cory Booker: ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs the American Dream: Together we work, together we rise."

"[President Trump] has failed us. But still, I believe in the dream of our ancestors.‚Äù #DemConvention https://t.co/yHdFIzNWOl

name: NPR
text:
A 95-year-old WWII veteran, Ed Good, who voted for Trump in 2016, expressed his support for Joe Biden at the #DemConvention.

‚ÄúI think Trump has been the worst president we‚Äôve ever had. So I‚Äôll be glad to see him go,‚Äù he said.
https://t.co/ZsjFQjUHPM

name: NPR
text:
Sen. Tammy Baldwin: ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs another part of my story.‚Äù

‚ÄúThe part where I worked with Joe Biden and Barack Obama to make sure kids ‚Ä¶ can stay on their parents‚Äô health insurance until they are 26. We got that done. And, yes, it was a big effing deal.‚Äù https://t.co/ePWfh4N3YB

name: NPR
text:
Democrats paid tribute tonight to Joe Biden‚Äôs late son, Beau, who died of cancer in 2015.

‚ÄúHe really was the best of us," Kamala Harris said recently. "And when I would ask him, ‚ÄòWhere‚Äôd this come from?‚Äô he‚Äôd always talk about his dad.‚Äù #DemConvention 
https://t.co/IlEd0T8KTa

name: NPR
text:
Pete Buttigieg: ‚ÄúI joined a military where firing me because of who I am wasn‚Äôt just possible ‚Äî it was policy."

Now "it is unlawful in America to fire someone because of who they are. ‚Ä¶ The very ring on my finger ‚Ä¶ reflects how this country can change.‚Äù https://t.co/LcQcBH2xs0

name: NPR
text:
A Trump campaign spokesman wrote off the far-right, wholly unsubstantiated QAnon conspiracy theory, telling NPR that he and President Trump rarely discussed it other than to say it was "junk."

Trump offered praise for the conspiracy's followers Wednesday.
https://t.co/h4lRv7RSYh

name: NPR
text:
Brayden Harrington, a 13-year-old with a stutter, recalled the time Joe Biden told him about his own experience growing up with a stutter.

‚ÄúWithout Joe Biden, I wouldn‚Äôt be talking to you today,‚Äù Harrington said.
https://t.co/zYMeHkAlYE

name: NPR
text:
Joe Biden is formally accepting the Democratic Party's nomination for president at the #DemConvention.

We're annotating his remarks live with analysis and fact checks.

Follow along üëá
https://t.co/umwKatnFgQ

name: NPR
text:
Joe Biden: ‚ÄúIf you entrust me with the presidency, I will draw on the best of us, not the worst.  I will be an ally of the light, not the darkness."

Follow along as we annotate his remarks:
https://t.co/jyOEXEZOWA

name: NPR
text:
JUST IN: Joe Biden has officially accepted the Democratic party‚Äôs presidential nomination more than three decades after his first failed White House campaign.
https://t.co/i0T9Y6cX00

text:
JUST IN: Joe Biden has officially accepted the Democratic Party‚Äôs presidential nomination more than three decades after his first failed White House campaign.

name: NPR
text: Joe Biden: "History has delivered us to one of the most difficult moments America‚Äôs ever faced.  Four, four histori‚Ä¶ https://t.co/neYtoaaKk3

name: NPR
text: Joe Biden slammed President Trump for continuing his administration's fight against the Affordable Care Act. https://t.co/tMRtEm4GRT https://t.co/N5uQ3JJgH7

name: NPR
text:
A major theme of tonight's #DemConvention was the argument that President Trump is not just ineffective ‚Äî but also a bad role model for kids.

For some swing voters, that may be a winning argument. https://t.co/UBln1yZkYq https://t.co/ZLcX9U3zQE

name: NPR
text:
Fact Check: In his speech, Joe Biden stated: "Five million Americans infected by COVID-19. More than 170,000 Americans have died."

That's accurate for the number of confirmed cases ‚Äî¬†and experts say the true total is certainly even higher. #DemConvention https://t.co/a7m8lSJpMz https://t.co/sGsuKyp7N7

name: NPR
text: The U.S. does have more than 5 million confirmed coronavirus cases, like Biden said at the #DemConvention, and that's more than any other nation in the world ‚Äî though experts say this is certainly an undercount. https://t.co/ss24sKDs7O https://t.co/boAmMqGYay

name: NPR
text:
Secretary of State Mike Pompeo has asked the U.N. Security Council to reinstate all of the sanctions against Iran that were terminated by the body 5 years ago ‚Äî along with arms restrictions soon set to expire.
https://t.co/dsKbaIxfKr

name: NPR
text:
Scam callers are posing as COVID contact tracers to get people's credit card or bank account information.

Authorities say legitimate tracers should not ask you for financial information, your social security number, or to click a link.
https://t.co/LwDCrlRG1T

name: NPR
text:
Joe Biden has proposed "a national mandate to wear a mask" to help combat the spread of the coronavirus.

Public health researchers say widespread mask-wearing could make it possible to keep infections low without needing total lockdowns. #DemConvention
https://t.co/pCsDff7F0a https://t.co/MnEFw8Vtz2

name: NPR
text:
Joe Biden's use of "systemic racism" at the #DemConvention stands in contrast to the approach taken by some Trump administration officials.

Attorney General Bill Barr has said he does not believe the criminal justice system suffers from systemic racism. https://t.co/lHh4v1cM2P https://t.co/2kqgaKUtS4

name: NPR
text:
Joe Biden made appeals to young people in his DNC speech, highlighting their work on issues like racial injustice and climate change.

Some young delegates had criticized the convention for not having enough generational diversity in the program. https://t.co/M0L9xnauDU https://t.co/6Wxb37xuNy

name: NPR
text:
Joe Biden: "May history be able to say that the end of this chapter of American darkness began here, tonight, as love and hope and light join in the battle for the soul of the nation."

Read our annotated version of Biden's #DemConvention speech:
https://t.co/vwlZCOu3d6

name: NPR
text:
Michigan has reached a $600 million deal to compensate Flint residents for its role in failing to protect them from lead-tainted water. Nearly 80% would go to resolve claims filed on behalf of minors and children.
https://t.co/ytt1JTsK7h

name: NPR
text:
Airbnb is indefinitely banning all parties at its listings worldwide and instituting an occupancy cap of 16 guests, saying the updated policy is "in the best interest of public health."
https://t.co/6EKCw6xh4d

name: NPR
text:
With little guidance from the federal government, colleges are implementing a dizzying variety of COVID-19 containment plans ‚Äî decisions that often have little correlation with the public health situation in the region. 
https://t.co/By6e7kDhnd

name: NPR
text:
Republican Sen. Bill Cassidy has tested positive for the coronavirus.

Here's a rundown of every member of Congress who's had a confirmed infection ‚Äî or had to quarantine after possible exposure ‚Äî since March.
https://t.co/SSqXuT8zee

name: NPR
text:
A new study finds there could be upwards of 21 million metric tons of plastic pollution in the Atlantic Ocean ‚Äî far more than scientists previously thought. 
https://t.co/PoesfNvxag
